topics: Class Work 5 - Project Optimization – Project Selection
Class Work 6 - Project Optimization – Resource Allocation; Project Financing
Class Work 7 - Decision-Making in Project Management
Class Work 9 – Optimal Strategies and Risk

grading.policies: Late assignments will be downgraded by 10 points per day.

policies.late_work: Late assignments will be downgraded by 10 points per day.
policies.academic_integrity: All students must adhere to the Graduate Student Code of Academic Integrity.
policies.accommodations: Stevens Institute of Technology provides appropriate accommodations to students with documented disabilities.

additional_info.course_format: The course will employ lectures, class discussion, individual assignments, and a final exam.
additional_info.technology_requirements: DecisionTools Suite software is recommended for creating decision trees.
additional_info.support_resources: Lecture notes and assignments can be found at https://sit.instructure.com/

_metadata.course_description: This course is designed to deepen the student’s ability to use various project management tools for planning, controlling and monitoring a project.
learning_outcomes: Identify and analyze project risks and develop contingency plans for those risks.
Analyze the impact of variability in project tasks and plans.
Choose the most appropriate resources to maintain the schedule and budget of a project.
Apply quantitative measures of project progress.
